intro: Asarca crocata, commonly known as the crocus lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, with six petals and a central cluster of stamens. Asarca crocata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
